Package de.oth.blocklib.helper.collider

Class Collider

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.helper.collider.Collider
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoxCollider, LineCollider, PointCollider, SphereCollider
public abstract class Collider
extends java.lang.Object
Author:
Florian Amthor

    • predictTerrainCollisions

      public TerrainCollisionData predictTerrainCollisions​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f velocity, int amountOfSteps, float deltaTime)
      Divides the position update of a collider in multiple steps. In each of these steps collisions are detected and if there are any, the information about these collisions is returned. IMPORTANT! Use this method before updating the object. Update the position of the colliders object, by using the deltaTimeUntilCollision value that is provided in the TerrainCollisionData DISADVANTAGE! If an object is moving that is permanently colliding, its speed can be reduced by Choosing a higher amountOfSteps
      Parameters:
      velocity - the current velocity of the object
      amountOfSteps - increases the accuracy and cost of the function.
      deltaTime - the deltaTime of the current Frame.
      Returns:
      An TerrainCollisionData Object that contains information about occurring collisions.

    • detectTerrainCollisions

      public TerrainCollisionData detectTerrainCollisions​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f velocity)
      Used to check collisions of an Collider with terrain. The performance can be further optimized in the future. created by Tobias Mueller and Florian Amthor
      Parameters:
      velocity - velocity is used to determine the movement direction
      Returns:
      an arrayList of all directions, in which a collision occurs

    • getCenter

      public abstract org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f getCenter()
      Get the middle of the Collider. Every Collider needs a center, for the getTerrainCollisions function to calculate the right collision vectors
      Returns:
      a Vector3f that represents the middle point of the Collider

    • setPosition

      Parameters:

    • isCollidingWithNearbyTerrainPiece

      checks the collision of the own Collider, with a piece of terrain.
      Parameters:
